engl102-emirates.title: ZMU ENGL102 The Emirates: Past, Present, Future
engl102-emirates.content:
ZMU - ENGL102 The Emirates: Past, Present, Future
Course Description
This course helps military cadets learn about the United Arab Emirates through stories, videos, and discussions. Students will explore how the UAE grew from a small desert region to a modern nation, and think about what the future might look like. The focus is on writing clearly about UAE’s journey and thinking about your role in its future.
Course Learning Outcomes
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

Understand UAE’s history and how it became successful
Write about UAE’s development in clear, simple essays
Think about the future and what it means for them as leaders
Connect past, present, and future to see how they fit together

Assignments (70% of final grade)
Essay 1: UAE’s Amazing Story (350 words)
Write about how the UAE changed from the past to today. Use examples from class materials.
Due: Week 5
Essay 2: UAE Today - What’s Special? (450 words)
Describe what makes the UAE special today. Compare it to other countries.
Due: Week 9
Essay 3: My Vision for UAE’s Future (550 words)
Think about the UAE in 20 years. What will it be like? What will you contribute?
Due: Week 12
Final Reflection (250 words)
Write about what you learned about the UAE and yourself in this course.
Due: Week 14
Weekly Activities (30% of final grade)

Short weekly reflections (100 words each)
Video discussions about UAE
Group projects about UAE topics
Class participation


Schedule
Unit 1: UAE Past - How It All Started (Weeks 1-3)
Week 1: Life Before the UAE
Focus: Understanding life in the old UAE

Readings:

Simple story about life in the desert
Article about pearl diving and traditional life


Film: Documentary clips about old UAE
Writing: “What I Know About Old UAE” (personal knowledge)
Discussion: What do you know about UAE’s past?

Week 2: Sheikh Zayed’s Vision
Focus: How one leader changed everything

Readings:

Story about Sheikh Zayed’s ideas
Simple explanation of UAE formation


Film: Documentary about UAE founding
Writing: Compare old UAE to new UAE
Discussion: What was Sheikh Zayed’s biggest contribution?

Week 3: Building the Nation
Focus: How the UAE was created

Readings:

Article about the 1971 formation
Story about bringing emirates together


Film: Clips about early UAE development
Writing: Essay 1 planning
Discussion: Why was it important to unite the emirates?


Unit 2: UAE Present - Success Today (Weeks 4-6)
Week 4: From Oil to Innovation
Focus: How UAE moved beyond oil

Readings:

Simple article about UAE’s economy
Story about Dubai’s growth


Film: “Dubai: Beyond Oil” documentary
Writing: Essay 1 draft workshop
Discussion: What makes UAE’s economy different?

Week 5: UAE as a Leader
Focus: How UAE leads in the region

Readings:

Article about UAE’s international role
Story about UAE’s space program


Film: Mars Mission highlights
Writing: Submit Essay 1: UAE’s Amazing Story
Discussion: How does UAE help other countries?

Week 6: Culture and Tradition
Focus: Balancing old and new in UAE

Readings:

Article about UAE culture
Story about modern Emiratis


Film: Clips about UAE festivals and traditions
Writing: Personal reflection on UAE identity
Discussion: How does UAE keep its culture while modernizing?


Unit 3: UAE Present - Modern Success (Weeks 7-9)
Week 7: Innovation and Technology
Focus: UAE as a tech leader

Readings:

Article about UAE’s smart cities
Story about digital government


Film: “Smart Dubai” documentary
Writing: Essay 2 planning
Discussion: How does technology make life better?

Week 8: Global Connections
Focus: UAE’s place in the world

Readings:

Article about UAE’s international relationships
Story about Expo 2020 Dubai


Film: Highlights from Expo 2020
Writing: Essay 2 workshop
Discussion: Why do other countries visit UAE?

Week 9: Youth and Education
Focus: UAE’s young people and their future

Readings:

Article about UAE education
Story about young Emiratis


Film: Clips about UAE universities and innovation
Writing: Submit Essay 2: UAE Today - What’s Special?
Discussion: What opportunities does UAE give young people?


Unit 4: UAE Future - What’s Next? (Weeks 10-12)
Week 10: Vision 2071
Focus: UAE’s plan for the future

Readings:

Simple explanation of Vision 2071
Article about UAE’s goals


Film: “UAE 2071” documentary
Writing: Essay 3 planning
Discussion: What do you want UAE to be like in 50 years?

Week 11: Environment and Sustainability
Focus: UAE’s green future

Readings:

Article about UAE’s environmental goals
Story about renewable energy


Film: “Green UAE” documentary
Writing: Essay 3 draft workshop
Discussion: How can UAE help solve environmental problems?

Week 12: Leadership in the Future
Focus: Your role as future leaders

Readings:

Article about future leaders
Story about youth and leadership


Film: Clips about young leaders
Writing: Submit Essay 3: My Vision for UAE’s Future
Discussion: What kind of leader does UAE need?


Unit 5: Your Role in UAE’s Future (Weeks 13-14)
Week 13: Contributing to UAE
Focus: How you can help UAE succeed

Readings:

Article about serving your country
Story about military service


Film: “Service to Nation” documentary
Writing: Final reflection planning
Discussion: How will you contribute to UAE?

Week 14: Course Reflection
Focus: What did you learn about UAE and yourself?

Activities:

Share favorite insights about UAE
Discuss how course changed your perspective
Peer feedback on essays


Writing: Final Reflection Submission
Discussion: Your commitment to UAE’s future


Required Course Materials
Reading Materials (All Provided Free)

UAE History Stories - Simple stories about UAE’s past
UAE Today Articles - Current information about UAE
Vision 2071 Materials - Easy explanations of UAE’s future plans
Leadership Examples - Stories about UAE leaders

Videos and Films

Documentary: “The Story of UAE”
Documentary: “Dubai: Beyond Oil”
Documentary: “UAE Space Program”
Documentary: “Expo 2020 Dubai”
Documentary: “Vision 2071”
Short clips about UAE culture and achievements

Writing Resources

UAE Facts Handbook - Important information about UAE
Essay Writing Templates - Simple essay structure guides
Timeline of UAE - Important dates and events
Citation Guide - How to credit sources


Grading System
Essay Grading (Simple 4-Point Scale)

Excellent - Clear ideas, good examples, shows understanding of UAE
Good - Clear main points, some examples, shows understanding
Needs Improvement - Some good ideas but unclear about UAE
Poor - Unclear ideas, missing examples, shows little understanding

Class Participation

Coming prepared with readings completed
Contributing to discussions about UAE
Participating in group activities
Showing respect for UAE culture and values


Course Policies
Attendance

Required - Important for understanding UAE culture
More than 3 absences may affect your grade
Contact instructor if you miss class due to military duties

Assignments

Due dates are firm - late work gets lower grades
Revisions allowed - You can improve essays after feedback
Original work only - No copying or plagiarism

Getting Help

Writing Center - Free tutoring available
UAE Studies resources - Extra materials about UAE
Office hours - Talk to instructor one-on-one
Arabic support - Help with Arabic sources if needed


Student Support
Academic Help

Writing tutors familiar with UAE content
Research assistance for UAE topics
Study groups with other cadets

Military Life Support

Flexible scheduling for training requirements
Leadership connections to UAE military
Service learning opportunities

UAE Culture Support

Cultural explanations for complex topics
Local examples throughout the course
Vision 2071 workshops for future planning
Leadership mentoring program

engl102-humanities.title: Sorbonne ENGL102 Writing in the Humanities
engl102-humanities.content:
Sorbonne ENGL102 Writing in the Humanities
Course Description
This course helps military cadets improve their writing skills while learning about leadership through interesting stories, movies, and real examples. Students will read short articles, watch films, and write essays about leadership within the humanities, in history, literature, and modern life. The focus is on clear communication and understanding what makes a good leader.
Course Learning Outcomes
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

Read and understand leadership stories and articles
Write clear essays about leadership topics
Discuss leadership ideas in class
Analyze what makes leaders successful or unsuccessful

Assignments
Major Assessments (70% of final grade)
Essay 1: My Favorite Leader (300 words)
Write about a leader you admire and explain why. Use examples from class readings or films.
Due: Week 5
Essay 2: Learning from Mistakes (400 words)
Analyze a leader who made a serious mistake. What did they do wrong and what can we learn?
Due: Week 9
Essay 3: Leadership Today (500 words)
Compare leadership in the past to leadership today. Use examples from course materials.
Due: Week 12
Final Reflection (200 words)
Write about what you learned about leadership and yourself in this course.
Due: Week 14
Weekly Activities (30% of final grade)

Short reading responses (100 words each)
Film discussions
Group activities
Class participation


Schedule
Unit 1: Introduction to Leadership (Weeks 1-3)
Week 1: What Makes a Good Leader?
Focus: Understanding leadership basics

Readings:

Simple leadership article from UAE
“Great Leaders” short article


Film: Short clips about famous leaders
Writing: “A Leader I Know” (personal story)
Discussion: Leaders you know

Week 2: Historical Leaders
Focus: Learning from the past

Readings:

Story about Sheikh Zayed
Brief story about George Washington


Film: “The King’s Speech” (selected parts)
Writing: Compare two leaders
Discussion: How do leaders inspire people?

Week 3: Modern Leadership
Focus: Leadership in today’s world

Readings:

Article about UAE leaders today
Story about a modern leader


Film: Clips about modern business leaders
Writing: Essay 1 draft workshop
Discussion: Can anyone be a leader?


Unit 2: Learning from Success (Weeks 4-6)
Week 4: Inspiring Others
Focus: How leaders motivate people

Readings:

Story about Nelson Mandela
Article about motivation


Film: “Invictus” (parts about reconciliation)
Writing: Essay 1 revision
Discussion: What motivates you to follow a leader?

Week 5: Making Tough Decisions
Focus: Leadership in difficult times

Readings:

Article about wartime decisions
Story about crisis leadership


Film: “Saving Private Ryan” (leadership scenes)
Writing: Submit Essay 1: My Favorite Leader
Discussion: When is it okay to make unpopular decisions?

Week 6: UAE Leadership
Focus: Leadership in the UAE context

Readings:

Sheikh Zayed’s philosophy
Article about UAE Vision 2071


Film: Documentary about UAE development
Writing: Personal reflection on UAE leadership
Discussion: How does UAE leadership reflect its culture?


Unit 3: Learning from Failure (Weeks 7-9)
Week 7: When Leaders Fail
Focus: Understanding leadership mistakes

Readings:

Story about a leader’s failure
Article about learning from mistakes


Film: “The Social Network” (leadership challenges)
Writing: Essay 2 planning
Discussion: Why do good leaders sometimes fail?

Week 8: Ethics and Leadership
Focus: Right and wrong in leadership

Readings:

Simple article about ethical leadership
Story about a moral choice


Film: “Letters from Iwo Jima” (honor across cultures)
Writing: Essay 2 workshop
Discussion: What would you do in this situation?

Week 9: Recovery and Redemption
Focus: Can leaders recover from failure?

Readings:

Story about leader’s comeback
Article about second chances


Film: Clips about resilience
Writing: Submit Essay 2: Learning from Mistakes
Discussion: Is redemption possible for leaders?


Unit 4: Leadership Today (Weeks 10-12)
Week 10: Team Leadership
Focus: Leading groups and teams

Readings:

Article about teamwork
Story about military teamwork


Film: “Apollo 13” (team leadership)
Writing: Essay 3 planning
Discussion: What makes a good team leader?

Week 11: Technology and Leadership
Focus: Leadership in the digital age

Readings:

Article about tech leaders
Story about digital transformation


Film: Clips about modern innovation
Writing: Essay 3 draft workshop
Discussion: How has technology changed leadership?

Week 12: Global Leadership
Focus: Leadership across cultures

Readings:

Article about international leaders
Story about cross-cultural leadership


Film: Documentary about global leaders
Writing: Submit Essay 3: Leadership Today
Discussion: What makes a leader work across cultures?


Unit 5: Your Leadership Future (Weeks 13-14)
Week 13: Leadership in the UAE
Focus: Your role as a future leader

Readings:

Article about UAE’s future leaders
Vision for young Emiratis


Film: “The Message” (Islamic leadership principles)
Writing: Final reflection planning
Discussion: What kind of leader do you want to be?

Week 14: Course Reflection
Focus: What did you learn?

Activities:

Share favorite insights from course
Discuss how course changed your thinking
Peer feedback on essays


Writing: Final Reflection Submission
Discussion: Your leadership goals for the future


Required Course Materials
Reading Materials (All Provided Free)

Simple Leadership Stories - Collection of easy-to-read articles
UAE Leadership Examples - Stories about UAE leaders
Historical Leadership Tales - Brief stories about famous leaders
Modern Leadership Articles - Current leadership examples

Films and Videos

“The King’s Speech” (selected scenes)
“Saving Private Ryan” (leadership scenes)
“Invictus” (reconciliation leadership)
“Apollo 13” (team leadership)
Short documentary clips about UAE leaders
TED Talks about leadership (simple versions)

Writing Resources

Basic Writing Handbook - Simple grammar and style guide
Essay Writing Templates - Step-by-step essay structure
Citation Guide - How to give credit to sources


Course Policies
Attendance

Required - Military training values discipline
More than 3 absences may affect your grade
Contact instructor if you miss class due to military duties

Assignments

Due dates are firm - late work gets lower grades
Revisions allowed - You can improve essays after getting feedback
Original work only - No copying or plagiarism

Getting Help

Writing Center - Free tutoring available
Peer study groups - Study with classmates
Office hours - Talk to instructor one-on-one
Arabic support - Help available if needed


Student Support
Academic Help

Writing tutors available daily
Study skills workshops offered monthly
Citation and research help provided

Military Life Support

Flexible scheduling for military training
Study groups with other cadets
Leadership mentoring from senior officers
Cultural adjustment support available

UAE Context Support

Local examples used throughout course
Arabic language resources when helpful
Cultural advisor available for questions
Vision 2071 connections to your future


Grade Breakdown

This course is designed specifically for first-year cadets at Zayed Military University. It focuses on building basic writing skills while learning about leadership through accessible stories and examples relevant to UAE culture and military life.
Grading System
Essay Grading (Simple 4-Point Scale)

Excellent - Clear ideas, good examples, well-organized
Good - Clear main points, some examples, mostly organized
Needs Improvement - Some good ideas but unclear or disorganized
Poor - Unclear ideas, missing examples, poorly organized

Class Participation

Coming prepared with readings completed
Contributing to class discussions
Working well in group activities
Being respectful to classmates and instructor
